noun.description: The action or an act of re-enforcing.
A person who or thing which re-enforces or strengthens; especially (frequently in plural) a person who or group which assists or strengthens a military force, etc.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in Raphael Holinshed (c1525–?1580), historian. From re- + enforcement, after re-enforce. Compare later reinforcement.
